characters: AN OPEN COPY OF THE BOOK OF THE DEAD
THE REAR DOOR OF THE CABIN
603C WORKING DUMMY HENRIETTA HEAD ON "FLYING HEAD RIG"
GLASS CASE CONTAINING PAGES FROM BOOK OF
POSSESSED ED AND JAKE STUNT MAN
ASH AND ANNIE AND OFF SCREEN
RIGGING FOR TRAP DOOR, CABINETS, CLOCK
MAGIC BLADE AND GUIDE TRACK RIG
SHOTS OF VINES COMING TOWARDS CAMERA
DUMMY HEAD OF DEADITE BLOOD SQUIB
JAKE, ED, ANNIE, AND BOBBY JOE
JAKE, BOBBY JOE, ANNIE AND ED
JAKE AND BOBBY JOE IN FOREGROUND
393F A SECTION OF THE TONGUE AND GROOVE FLOOR
FROM RAVINE, LOOKING UPWARD AT ASH AND DELTA
CONTAINING ASH'S "HERO FROM THE SKY" ILLUSTRATION.
LOOKING UP TO THEM FROM CELLAR
ASH IN GRIP OF GIANT TREE BRANCH
POSSESSED ED, (FRAMED WITH AND W/O HEAD)
ASH IN GRIP OF TREE BRANCH
ASH AND LINDA'S HEAD IN VICE
THE GROUP AND THE GHOST OF RAYMOND
ANNIE, ASH, JAKE, BOBBY JOE AND ED
PAGE OF THE BOOK OF THE DEAD
IMO CAMERA MOUNTED ON LONG POLE AND TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: A sound is building.  Like a living wind.  A thousand screams in agony. From the blackness, gusts of smoke pull together quickly, forming the Main Title against black:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then beneath it, the Roman Numeral "II." A SLOW ZOOM brings it toward us.  And as the screams reach their sharp crescendo the title zooms through us.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION
dialogues.text: Whisping smoke against a black background. EERIE MUSIC.  In the distance, through the smoke, a small object. It fans toward us quickly, filling the frame. It is an ancient skin covered volume, with the outline of a human face on it's cover. This is the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend has it, that it was written by the dark ones: NECRONOMICON EX MORTES; Roughly translated...The Book of the Dead. The face on the cover of the book pulls away from its skin binding and leans toward the camera. EYES on the book blink open and peer at us. It's mouth opens and emits a hideous scream. The CAMERA races into the blackness of the screaming mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STAND
dialogues.text: Spiraling downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To trace the origin of the Book, we must go back...back...to a day when spirits ruled the earth. Wispy shapes of animated ghosts move through this vortex, coming toward the CAMERA with WAILING and MOANING  and then are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the seas ran red with blood.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: A raging ocean of blood.  Great waves rise and swell as if before a storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was this blood that was used to ink the book.

dialogues.speaker: STAND
dialogues.text: Through animation, the blank pages of the Book are scripted in a strange hieroglyphic by an invisible hand. Faster and faster the pages turn on the Book as the blood red ink is scrawled across them. The pages flip furiously until the Book snaps shut, reveal ing its gruesome face on the cover. The book flaps violently away from camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Book of the Dead was last seen in 1300 A.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA panning down to reveal a magnificent newly built castle of stone.  Bright banners fly from its turrets. An ox grazes nearby.  4 Warriors on horseback in the BG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was then that the dark spirits again rose up to battle the living. The ground in front of the castle begins to split apart. A red glow and smoke pour from the growing crevice. Something evil is being unleashed.  A strong wind kicks up blowing sand in a furious rage.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Through the blowing silt, a lone figure appears.  An image of power and light.  His clothing is ragged, and he holds what appears to be a jagged toothed longsword.  Two massive columns of stone stand on either side.  CAMERA slowly moves closer, but his face is still hidden by the darkness and blowing sands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is said that a hero came from the sky.  A man who defeated this evi and buried the Book in the Castle of Kandar. And there it lay for 700 years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the raging dust storm clears to reveal the same castle which we saw earlier, but now, in a ruined state. It has aged 700 years.  The ox is gone.  Now only its petrified skeletal remains stand in a weathered heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Waiting. A four wheel drive vehicle roars PAST THE CAMERA and toward the castle.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA slowly tracks in toward the Book of the Dead as it sits in the darkness of the stone tomb. Next to it rests the KANDARIAN DAGGER, an ancient knife, its handle fashioned from the skull of a weasel. They rest upon a small pedestal covered with cobwebs. Prominently displayed on the stone wall, a bas relief of the "Hero from the Sky" holding his unusual jagged edged weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then... The grinding of rock scraping against rock is heard, and a large stone is swung open on a secret hinge in the wall behind the book. Wind sweeps in through the tomb, along with the blinding light from outside. A sharply silhouetted figure steps in the newly created doorway. The figure lights a torch that he holds, illuminating his face.  This is PROFESSOR RAYMOND KNOWBY.  An intelligent, grey bearded man in his late fifties. He lowers the cloth around his face that had been protecting him from the sand.  He stares at the Book, awestruck. Behind him, two other figures appear in the entrance of the tomb. The first is a large school-marmish woman, the wife of Raymond Knowby, HENRIETTA. She moves to Raymond's side and takes his hand.  Immediately behind her is their daughter, ANNIE KNOWBY; twenty-four years old, strong stance and beautiful.  Behind her a handsome looking man, ED GETLY, enters the tomb.  He moves to Annie's side.  They exchange excited glances. The CAMERA PANS down to the Book.

dialogues.speaker: FOG
dialogues.text: Billowing past the camera in front of a black drape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old log cabin, built in the valley of a dark forest. A great wind billows fog about the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Raymond Knowby and his wife, HENRIETTA, brought the book to a small cabin where they could study it undisturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Raymond Knowby sits at a writing desk and transcribes passages from the Book of the Dead.  A small framed photograph of his daughter Annie sits upon the table.  Behind him, HENRIETTA sits knitting in a rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: He speaks the phonetic pronunciation of completed sentences into the microphone of a tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanda...Es-trata...Ta-toon...Hazan sobar...Ear-Grets, Gat, ...Nos-feratos ...Amantos...Kanda! The sound of RAYMOND reciting the passages is faded down AS THE CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS away from RAYMOND and over to HENRIETTA as she rocks back into the darkness and forward into the light.  As she rocks forward into the light, she comes into FULL CLOSEUP revealing that her eyes have changed to a milky white.  She continues to knit.

dialogues.speaker: FOG
dialogues.text: Blowing past the camera in front of black drape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dank fruit cellar with shelves of half-rotten preserves.  Raymond has his back to the stone wall. He is dictating into the tape recorder, sweating and distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has only been a few hours since I've translated and spoke aloud the first of the demon resurrection passages from the Book of the Dead. The sound of heavy footsteps.  Dust drifts down INTO FRAME.  Raymond looks up to the ceiling of the cellar. It is also the floor to the main room of the cabin. He watches in horror as Henrietta's silhouette paces the floor above him.  And then, the footsteps halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, I fear that my wife has become host to a Kandarian demon.  May God forgive me for what I have unleashed onto this earth.

dialogues.speaker: 13Y REVERSE ACTION
dialogues.text: The milky eyed possessed figure of HENRIETTA jolts quickl into the frame, and shrieks in the voice of a demon! Raymond Knowby screams.  He drops the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: TAPE RECORDER
dialogues.text: As the microphone falls atop it.  High pitched feed- back screams from the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Screaming in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fearful eyes fill the screen as the scream continues.

dialogues.speaker: 13C EXTREME C.U. RAYMOND'S EYE
dialogues.text: Darting about wildly and the scream continues.

dialogues.speaker: ROUNDY-ROUNDY
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVING swiftly down a dark tunnel. A light at the end growing closer. The SOUND of AIR RUSHING BY. The Delta 88 Oldsmobile comes ROARING out of the tunnel with a BLAST of AIR, and the sound of loud rock and roll music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was one week later that a group of college students came to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delta 88 Oldsmobile parked out front.  Fog roars past the place.  We faintly hear waltz music from within.  The silhouette of a woman sweeps by the rear bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA
dialogues.text: LINDA, an attractive college student, is waltzing in the semi darkness of the bedroom.  She wears a "Michigan State University" sweatshirt.  She hums melodically to the music as she moves.  Around her neck is draped a delicate silver necklace.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA
dialogues.text: A handsome young man, ASH, is playing the waltz music on an old wooden piano.  Linda dances behind him.  Ash is not a very good pianist, and can only plunk out the melody with two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash, what's that you're playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our song. Ash begins to play faster.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA
dialogues.text: As she picks up the tempo, spinning and laughing, until finally Ash moves to her, halting her in mid spin.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Out of breath, hair tousled across her eyes, she stares deeply into Ash's eyes.  Her lips, parted, in a sensual manner.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He returns her stare, lost in her beauty.  He pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: 14G SHE PULLS AWAY SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: And looks down to the tiny silver necklace that she wears about her neck.

dialogues.speaker: NECKLACE
dialogues.text: In its center is a magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA AND ASH
dialogues.text: She looks from the necklace to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really love it.  I'll never take it off. They kiss and now begin to dance together, to the haunting waltz melody that sweeps up upon the soundtrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in the cabin's cellar that they found the Professor's tape recorder, and the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA tracks in toward the trap door.  It opens by itself as we move down the steps into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CABIN CELLAR
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pans down from the blackness to Ash who finds a shotgun, Raymond Knowby's tape recorder, tapes, the Kandarian dagger and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the shattered photograph of Annie Knowby and the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CABIN MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: The group of students sit about the fire as they listen to the tape recorder. Coming from the speaker is the voic of Raymond Knowby reciting the demon resurrection passage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kan Da, Es-trata ta-toon hazan sobar ...Ear-Grets, Gat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda takes Ash's hand.  She's frightened.  Ash smiles to comfort her.  She nervously fingers the silver locket she wears about her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nos-Feratos...Amantos...Kanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin is in the distance.  In the foreground the earth begins to swell, then rips apart as a red glow emanates from beneath.  Something evil is being unleashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, they fell to the possession of the dark spirits.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Her eyes pop open.  They are bone white.  She has fallen to the possession.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA
dialogues.text: Possessed Linda is coming after Ash.  Ash back peddles, stumbles and falls.

dialogues.speaker: ASH ON GROUND
dialogues.text: As the Shadow of approaching Linda envelops Ash, he picks up a shovel from the ground. 22C   LINDA LEAPS OVER THE CAMERA, TOWARD HIM.

dialogues.speaker: 22D LINDA DUMMY
dialogues.text: Ash swings the shovel, slicing off Linda's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda's head rolls down the hillside and disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA
dialogues.text: Ash buries Linda's headless body.  He jams a crude wooden burial cross into the earth of the grave.  A bolt of lightning strikes.

dialogues.speaker: 22G HILLSIDE
dialogues.text: As he runs from the grave site and toward the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man, Ash, destroyed the Book. Ash enters the cabin.  He sees The Book of the Dead and tosses it onto the flames.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION
dialogues.text: A possessed demon begins to wither and melt. Flesh shrinks away from its skull and dissolves to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the evil that had been resurrected from it, lives on.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION
dialogues.text: The Book of the Dead is burned to cinders.  The face upon the Book screams as it burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash picks himself up from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash stands and clutches the necklace of Linda, in sorrow for his loss of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash staggers from the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL DEAD I
dialogues.text: We are racing forward.  We have taken the POV of an EVIL ENTITY as it glides with dark purpose through a section of woods. It approaches the rear door of the cabin.  The door is torn violently open.  The next door falls away from us.  We approach the front door. SLAM! It jigsaws in two and we are again outside, now in front of the cabin.  Ash is seen in the distance.  He is staggerin away, his back to us as we race at him.  He turns suddenl towards CAMERA and screams.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVOLOMETER STOP MOTION/CRANE
dialogues.text: The final shot of Evil Dead I has a new ending; an extension. Ash is caught by an invisible grip. "G" force is distorting Ash's face as he is rocketed backwards.  He is swept hand over foot through the air.  He reaches the edge of the woods and begins tearing through the branches and smaller trees, clearing a path with his body.  He finally slams into a large ungiving tree trunk and he is knocked unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UPWARD
dialogues.text: As he falls from the tree branch and plummets towards the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A puddle of mud below, which rushes up upon us quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MUD PUDDLE
dialogues.text: As his head splashes down into the muddy water.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He lifts his face from the mud, and turns toward us. His eyes have gone white. His skin is now a pale color, his lips, jet black.  He is Possessed.  A bright edge of morning sunlight moves across his face.  He turns his beastly face skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT - THE SUN (Miniature) Rising over a mountain ridge.  Sunlight streaming through a gaping hole in the parting clouds, in bright shafts.  It pours through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: Closer on the sun as it looms larger and brighter.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: The frame is filled with the rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bright edge of morning sunlight spreading across his face, he lets loose a demonic death shriek.

dialogues.speaker: DUMMY HEAD
dialogues.text: The white in Ash's eyes swirls about, and his pupils change back to their original brown color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash, no longer possessed, collapses into the mud puddle, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streams of morning sunlight pierce the darkness of the woods.  We hear the shriek of demons.  The sound of SIZZLING.  A great wind blows back fog into the darker sections of the woods.  The scene grows brighter and the peaceful sounds of morning are faded up.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he lies unconscious.  Time passes.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: His eyes open.  They stare blankly up at the sky.  Then fear registers and we CRANE BACK QUICKLY, revealing a vast area of empty woods around Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He sits up slowly into frame, looking fearfully about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panning the battered cabin and sections of the woods. All is peaceful.  The sound of birds tweeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone. He looks up to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: Just above the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun's driven it away... for now.  Gotta get the hell out of here... before night falls.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he nods to himself, then suddenly glances up beyond the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: A perfectly normal log cabin with one exception; superimposed over the front of the place is...

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL CAMERA
dialogues.text: A hideous human skull with living eyeballs that stare out at us with evil malice.  The eyes stare out from the two dark windows.  The dark nose area is the open doorway, and the rotted teeth of the skull are the whitewashed stones placed at the foot of the cabin. Then it fades, leaving only the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He shudders uncontrollably as he picks himself up from the mud. Ash MOVES INTO A CLOSE UP.  His eyes shift back and forth like a trapped animal as he looks about for a means of escape.  He spots something.

dialogues.speaker: THE DELTA 88 OLDSMOBILE
dialogues.text: Parked in front of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He shifts his glance from the car to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow dirt road cutting through the woods. Then, the Delta 88 roars down it, and past the CAMERA.  It kicks up dust and gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CAR MOUNT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash is driving.  He wipes the mud and blood from his face with a rag.  As he pulls the rag away, his face forms a sudden look of horror as he sees:

dialogues.speaker: TRACKING SHOT
dialogues.text: A GIANT STEEL HAND LOOMS towards us. It is the twisted remains of the steel and wood bridge that crossed a great mountain chasm.  A LOUD SCREECH of brakes is heard on the soundtrack on this cut.

dialogues.speaker: DELTA 88
dialogues.text: As it pulls to a halt. Ash steps quietly from the car. He looks at the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: A sign hangs from the twisted girders.  It reads:

dialogues.speaker: "DANGEROUS BRIDGE
dialogues.text: RISK."  Beyond this we see the twisted remnants of the former bridge and the rock cliffs far away on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: FROM RAVINE, LOOKING UPWARD AT ASH AND DELTA
dialogues.text: (5 FRAMINGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash gapes at the uncrossable chasm.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He is stunned at the sight.  His only escape, gone. He looks from the bridge to the West.

dialogues.speaker: LONG SHOT
dialogues.text: The sun is now resting on the horizon.  Lower than it was before.  It is BLOOD RED, and sets in the course of seven seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: To reveal Ash as he looks from the sunset, to the ruined bridge, to the road behind him.  He moves in halting steps, not knowing which way to turn. Ash opens his mouth, draws in his breath, and just as he begins to scream, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAS
dialogues.text: As it rises up from what appears to be the mountain chasm and reveals the opposite side of the twisted girders which form the "Giant Hand."  It spots Ash immediately beyond.  It moves swiftly towaad him. Ash looks up, sensing the evil and darts into the Delta 88.  The FORCE moves through the twisted girders, pushing them away violently and races towaad the car. The Delta starts up and peels off.  The Evil Force just misses it.  The car doesn't have the room to complete the one hundred and eighty degree turn necessary to head back down the road the way it originally came, and is forced into a line of break- away trees which explode into sawdust as the front of the Delta 88 rips through them.  The car swerves onto the road, headed back toward the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As the broken bits of tree slam against his windshield.

dialogues.speaker: CAR RADIO/TAPE DECK
dialogues.text: As the channel switches suddenly to the hard rock song "Journey to the Center of Your Mind" which blares within the car throughout the chase to follow.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: As it gives chase to the Delta.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Alongside the car as it barrels along the wooded road.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: As he drives this wild course.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: As it begins to gain on the speeding automobile.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Looking through the windshield, as branches beat and smash themselves against the windshield, obscuring our vision of the "Road" ahead.  Our view suddenly clears, revealing a large tree that looms directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Swerving the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DELTA
dialogues.text: It swerves and slams into a rotted tree, stopping it dead.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he is rocketed forward from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF DELTA
dialogues.text: As Ash comes ripping through the windshield and past the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he approaches the ground with a great velocity.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he slams into the earth with a rain of glass.  He moans and gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: As it sweeps down out of the woods, pushing over trees, and approaches the Delta.  Steam pours from the hood of the car.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he runs.  His face is cut and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As he runs toward the cabin.  (Actually he is running in place in the rear of a camera car that is slowly backing away from the cabin.)  The more he runs, the farther away from the cabin he gets.

dialogues.speaker: "RAM-O-CAM"
dialogues.text: It approaches the rear of the Delta, rips through the back window, moves through the car's interior, music still blasting, and bursts out the remains of the front windshield.  We move through the steam of the radiator and approach Ash as he runs for the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he runs toward the cabin not making much progress as though caught running in a nightmare.  He shakes his head "No."

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Now closer to the cabin.  (Again, Ash is running in place in the camera car as it slowly backs away from the cabin.)

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: Now quickly gaining its lost ground.  Just a few feet behind Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he runs up the porch steps to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: We race into the cabin, splintering the hall door which Ash had swung shut.  Ash retreats into the rear hallway, and swings the hallway door shut.  We race right up to the door and it shatters into many pieces as we glide forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera moves through the main room and up to the Hallway door.  It shatters in front of us.  We close in on Ash as he races down the hallway.  We lose him as he swings into the back bedroom of the cabin and slams the door behind him.  We rip through this door and enter the rear bedroom, only to see Ash scrambling for the door to the middle bedroom, which we approach and he swings shut in our face.  We rip through to reveal Ash scurrying into the Hallway.  We follow him through the bathroom, the maze, and back out into the Hallway.  We round the corner after him and see that Ash has led us into the main room, but there is not a trace of him.  We look about for him, but he is gone. The hallway is bare except for a few dry leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force begins to pull back with an ever-increasing speed, out the front door of the cabin, and deep into the blackness of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A static shot of the fireplace.  All is quiet.  Smoke from the near dead fire wafts up the chimney.  We hold on this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE BEDROOM CLOSET
dialogues.text: A static shot of a closet with it's door half open. The door begins to swing slightly open, revealing a rack of clothes inside.  We hold on this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: A writing desk with some papers atop it.  They begin to tremble and finally blow away from the light breeze that sweeps through the cabin.  The CAMERA PANS down from this desk to reveal a trap door in the floor of the main room.  The trap door to the cellar.  It is raised up on its hinge an inch or so and in that slight space between the trap door and the floor we see Ash's eyes, looking cautiously about.  He breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin in the distance.  Fog rolls past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Getly stands in the FG and watches as an older style twin engine cargo plane flies over the camera and lands.

dialogues.speaker: 149L AIRSTRIP
dialogues.text: The airplane rolls to a halt.  A man wearing a jumpsuit ties the airplane off and blocks the wheels while a redcap opens the hatch and helps out Annie Knowby.  She carries a glass case in her hand as she moves toward us.  Behind her five other passengers emerge from the Plane.  Ed approaches Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at sight of him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. They embrace and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd everything go on the expedition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.  I found the additional pages from the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you said in the telegram.  What condition are they in? She holds out the glass case for Ed to look at.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS CASE
dialogues.text: Inside are 12 pages from the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't aged a day in three thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we begin the translations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.  Is everything all set with my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be, but I haven't spoken to him in a week, what with no phone in that cabin.  Take us about an hour to get there. They arrive at the parking lot.  Two new, sharp looking cheverolets and Ed's old style cheverolet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take my car. Ed opens the car trunk.  Behind him a redcap pulls up a large steamer trunk on a hand dolly.  Ed and the redcap hoist the steamer up into the car's trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, you hinted in your telegram that your father was on to something with the first part of his translations.  What's the big mystery?  What has he found in The Book of the Dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe nothing.  But just possibly... the doorway to another world? Annie slams the car trunk.

dialogues.speaker: CHEVROLET CAR TRUNK
dialogues.text: CAMERA has taken the POV of the evil force as it glides eerily through the woods, around trees and over rotted stumps.  It moves over a rise revealing a clear view of the boarded cabin in the distance.  It approaches. It moves to the window, and peering through the cracks in the boards we see Ash asleep in the rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera begins on hammer, nails, and planking which lay upon the cabin floor.  Camera pans to window #1. It is boarded up tight.  Camera pans to door.  It is repaired.  Camera pans to Ash who sleeps in the rocking chair in front of another boarded window. Ash awakens suddenly, sensing something, the shotgun clutched in his lap.  He lifts his head and turns to a whispering musical sound.  Harp like music. It is coming from the back bedroom of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he stands and moves cautiously towards the rear bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE ROOM AND REAR BEDROOM
dialogues.text: As he approaches the rear bedroom, the music grows louder As he enters the room he halts his gaze on the old wooden piano.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he moves to the piano.  The sound is coming from within.  Suddenly, the piano begins to play by itself; Ash draws back from it.  It plays a waltz.  Now the piano music mixing with the harp-like strings.  The radiator next to the piano begins to release bursts of musical steam, adding a wind section to this strange orchestra.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he listens to this haunting version of a waltz melody. He recognizes the music.  It is the same music that Ash had played earlier, when Linda was dancing.

dialogues.speaker: PIANO AND RADIATOR
dialogues.text: As steam spouts from the radiator pipes.  As the piano keys depress and release themselves.  The melody grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he lowers his head.  His horror gives way to sadness. From his pocket he removes Linda's delicate silver locket that dangles from the end of a chain.  In the locket's center is a magnifying glass.  He stares mournfully into the glass.  BANG!  He looks up sharply toward the main room.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTTERS
dialogues.text: As they rip open, splintering Ash's reinforcements. Wind sweeps in through the place as the curtains flutter wildly.  Through the window is a sweeping fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash runs through this room and into the main room.  He moves to the window and looks out.  Wind blowing on his face from outside.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAVEYARD
dialogues.text: A stark wooden cross marks Linda's lonely grave.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN IN DISTANCE
dialogues.text: The tiny figure of Ash can be seen looking off toward this hill.  In the foreground is a crude burial cross and a mound of earth.  The earth begins to crack and splinter.  The wooden cross caves in and is swallowed as the headless corpse of Linda pulls itself to its feet.  The HAUNTING WALTZ MELODY sweeps through the night air.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: His eyes, illuminated by a shaft of light, widen in amazement and horror as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WALTZ MELODY fills the sound track, and the rotting corpse that was Linda begins to dance, bending and swaying as she sweeps gracefully through the evening fog.  A waltz of the dead. The style of dance begins to change.  It becomes more primitive.  The music changes to a more primal beat. The dance becomes sexually oriented.  Erotic, with sharp pelvic thrusts and gyrating hip motions.

dialogues.speaker: THRU THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Lost in the horrific beauty, he turns his head to a rumbling sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda's DECAPITATED HEAD rolls across the ground and up the hillside graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it leaps through the air and gracefully situates itself atop Linda's neck, she begins to spin, yet her head remains in place, never taking her eyes from Ash. With a sensual twirl and leap, she disappears into the evening mists.

dialogues.speaker: THRU WINDOW
dialogues.text: His eyes dart about, trying to catch another glimpse of Linda through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: THRU WINDOW
dialogues.text: Linda swings sharply into frame, completing the spin of her dance immediately in front of Ash as the music abruptly halts.

dialogues.speaker: DANCE WITH ME
dialogues.text: Linda extends her dead arms towards Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He screams as...

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S CORPSE, (OVERCRANKED)
dialogues.text: Linda's head rolls off of her neck and tumbles through space.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD
dialogues.text: As it tumbles through a void of blackness, falling.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he screams himself awake.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal him sitting in the rocking chair.  Ash halts his scream, getting control of himself.  He looks to the window that had blown open.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOARDED WINDOW
dialogues.text: Still boarded as though it had never been opened.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Reassuring himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all.  Just a crummy dr- Linda's decapitated head falls into frame and lands in Ash's hands.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD
dialogues.text: It opens its eyes and looks to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello lover, I came from the other side of your dream to dance with you.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD, (BACKWARD MOTION)
dialogues.text: A four foot long blackened tongue emerges from her mouth like a lashing serpent.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The tongue enters Ash's frame and forces itself into Ash's mouth.  Screaming as he clutches at the head of his former love.  The tongue instantly retracts inside her head.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD
dialogues.text: As it bites deeply into Ash's right hand, drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA'S DUMMV HEAD
dialogues.text: Ash stands and rushes across the room screaming, as he tries to rid himself of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ash staggers painfully around the side of the cabin and towards the work shed; Linda's head still clamped to his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the place is kicked open, revealing Ash and Linda's head on the end of his hand.  It is a room full of sawdust, chains and power tools.  Old bones hang from the walls.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WORK SHED
dialogues.text: As he places Linda's head within the vice and tightens it around her, then withdraws his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even now we have your darling Linda's soul!  She suffers in torment!

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: As it rips away an old tarp revealing the chalk outline of where a chainsaw once was.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Confused.  Wondering what has happened to the chainsaw.  Behind him, the door to the shed bursts open and in comes the flailing, headless, body of Linda, charging at Ash with the chainsaw buzzing high above her head.  Ash is screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash grabs a large crowbar and swings it toward the approaching blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowbar hits the bottom of the blade with a shower of sparks, sending the buzzing saw flipping backward.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLESS LINDA DUMMY
dialogues.text: The blade of the chainsaw swings upward and arcs back into headless Linda, imbedding itself in her neck.  She goes nuts as the chainsaw bites its way into her chest cavity.  She spins wildly about the room knocking into shelves as she tries to pull the blade free.  She slams against the wall of the shed, and slumps to the floor, the chainsaw still buzzing.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he is splattered with black bile.  He reaches down.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLESS LINDA
dialogues.text: As Ash dislodges the spinning chainsaw from her.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he swings the chainsaw around and poises it above Linda's head.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND LINDA'S HEAD IN VICE
dialogues.text: From the chainsaw, fumes of blue amoke.  Ash turns to the head and falters.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD IN VICE
dialogues.text: She is no longer possessed.  She looks as she did earlier in the film.  A vision of beAuty.  She is again Linda, the woman Ash loved.  Tears roll down from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Ash, help me.  I love you, please don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Trying to fight his feelings, he knows what he must do.  He pumps the throttle on the saw.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Pleading with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised me we'd always be together.  You swore to me!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Agonized.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Once again fully possessed, and speaking in the voice of the demon.  Her eyes again white, her flesh, rotten.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S DUMMY HEAD
dialogues.text: She opens her mouth and emits a jet stream of bile.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he's drenched in the face.  Linda begins to laugh at him in a wild, high pitched squeal. He gains control of himself and steadies the saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat chainsaw. He brings down the spinning blade.  And moves past the CAMERA and towards the head.  We are left looking at the wall of the work shed upon which we see the stark shadow of the ghastly deed.  We hear the sound of spinning steel meeting bone and the screams of a demon.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT BULB
dialogues.text: As it is splattered with blood.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash stumbles back into frame and falls against the wall, now lit in crimson.  He looks at the off screen carnage in terror.  He begins to shake as though in shock.  He trembles as he looks down at his hands; they are covered in Linda's blood. He wipes his hands on his pants and shirt, trying to rid himself of it, but only succeeds in painting himself with the stuff.  Ash screams a wild scream of fear and despair.  It echoes off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WORK SHED
dialogues.text: Ash in a confused state as he staggers from the work shed and towards the cabin.  Again clutching the chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash enters through the doorway.  He pushes the door shut behind him and halts.  We hear a creaking sound. It is coming from the main room of the cabin.  He moves in the direction of the sound.

dialogues.speaker: SLOWLY FORWARD
dialogues.text: Curtains flutter on the partially boarded windows of the hall.  Ash moves slowly past them and towards the main room ahead.  The gentle creaking sound grows louder.  Ash tosses down the saw and picks up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash enters from the hallway and turns his head to the sound.

dialogues.speaker: 189C MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: It rocks back and forth with a definitive motion, halting for a moment at it's pints furthest forward and backward, as if some invisible thing was sitting there and rocking.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He slowly approaches the chair, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: FROM BEHIND THE ROCKING CHAIR
dialogues.text: The chair rocks in and out of frame in the foreground as Ash takes halting steps towards it.  Ash gathers his courage and reaches out his hand to halt the rocking motion.  Slowly his hand approaches the chair. Just as his hand goes to touch it, the chair abruptly halts, on its own accord.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: In a confused state as he backs away from the chair and into the wall.  He turns and comes face to face with himself in a hanging framed mirror.  He clutches at his face, trying to reassure himself of his sanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine... I'm fine...

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Ash's reflection becomes an independent entity.  It reaches out of the mirror and grabs ahold of Ash by his throat.  The reflection looks like a Mr. Hyde version of Ash.  Sweating and nasty looking.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL CAMERA, (ASH AS MR. HYDE)
dialogues.text: The reflection pulls Ash close and speaks to him in an intimate whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we're "fine".  We're losing it...  starting to slip.  We just cut up our girlfriend with a chainsaw.  Does that sound fine? The reflection tightens its hold on Ash's throat and begins to strangle him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Two hands in the bottom of frame, throttling him. CAMERA races back to reveal Ash's own hands on his throat There is no sign of Ash's evil reflection.  Ash has been strangling himself.  He realizes this the same moment we do.  He quickly pulls his hands away, looks at them incredulously, then to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: His reflection is as it should be.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He looks back down to his hands.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVOLOMETER
dialogues.text: The bite marks that Linda's teeth have left in the hand stand out sharply.  The wound suddenly blackens and spiderwebs it's infection across the entire surface of th hand.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The hand quivers and shakes, now out of Ash's control. The hand has taken a whitish cast.  It's veins throb and pulsate.  It is possessed by the evil force.  The hand's fingernails grow inches.  The wound oozes black fluid. Ash is repulsed.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash's demon hand makes a lunge at his face which is countered by his good hand.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He slams the hand to the cabin floor.  He screams to the air:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards.  Give me back my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and fog swirl about the place.  Ash's ECHOING SCREAM is heard above the HOWLING GALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back my hand!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash rushes into the kitchen and places his hand in the sink.  He turns on the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool water runs over Ash's burned hand.  Ash rests his head on the kitchen counter and mumbles reassurances to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't... can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: As the water pours over it.  It grabs a plate sitting in the dishwater and reaches up silently out of the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plate is shattered over Ash's head.  The hand grabs Ash's hair and mercilessly slams his head down upon the kitchen counter again and again. Ash punches himself in the face and is sent reeling backwards.  He smashes into a cupboard where dishes and plates fall upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand picks up plates and begins breaking them over Ash's head.  Then a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash is knocked unconscious.  The hand continues breaking objects over his head.  Ash lies unmoving, but still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand stops as though it senses something.  The CAMERA PANS to a large meat cleaver which lies upon the wooden floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand as it independently crawls towards the meat cleaver.  The hand is stopped when it runs out of arm, now anchored by Ash's unconscious body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It digs its nails deep into the floorboards and begins to pull...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: ... as he is pulled along the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: As it pulls Ash's unconscious body along after it. The hand clutches the meat cleaver when a large knife comes slicing through the demon hand, pinning it to the floorboards.  CAMERA pulls over to reveal a revived Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's laughing now?

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He reaches over with his good hand and pulls a fire engine red chainsaw down from the shelf. He holds the body of the machine between his legs and, with his good hand, pulls the starter cord.  The CHAINSAW ROARS to life.  The CAMERA TRACKS IN to Ash's sweating face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's laughing now!? He lowers the spinning blade of the chainsaw down out of frame and toward the evil hand.  Blood flies up into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the BUZZING of the CHAINSAW as it slices through bone and then falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA cranes down as Annie's car approaches from the distance. It pulls to a halt. Ed and Annie step from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red tow truck with its orange lights flashing is parked there. Painted on it's side is "Jake's Gas N' Go." Jake, a toothless, backwoods, greasemonkey is setting up flares and wooden roadblocks.  Annie and Ed approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  This the road to the Knowby's cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas' right.  But you ain't goin' there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: As he reaches in his truck to pull on the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: As they snap on.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, ANNIE, AND ED
dialogues.text: All stand in the bright glare of the lights as the fog swirls about them.  Annie and Ed gape in frightened wonder at what they see.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE TOP MODEL GIRDERS
dialogues.text: The piercing beams of light illuminate twisted remnants o the destroyed bridge that leads to the cabin.  A road sig similar to the one on the other side of the bridge reads: "Dangerous Bridge - Two Ton Weight Limit".

dialogues.speaker: ED AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Frightened as they view the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, I ain't never seen nothin' like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.  Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be another way in. Another road or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure ain't no, road. CAMERA pans over to reveal a brassy southern spitfire of a woman, Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell you wanna go there for, anyway? Bobby Joe takes a pinch of chewing tobacco and stuffs it into her mouth.  She doesn't like Annie and her fancy clothes.  She stares at Annie like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ED
dialogues.text: Annie steps forward.  She eyes Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He feigns surprise and pleasantness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  I just remembered... Yeah, that's right... There is a trail. You could follow Bobby Joe and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, it'll cost ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty Fi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks up suddenly at Bobby Joe who gives a sharp shake of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what.  You take my bags you got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He glances through the window of Annie's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny case containing the missing pages of the Book of the Dead, and a small handbag.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Looking back to Annie, a big smile on his near toothless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hiking trail winds through the woods.  Bobby Joe leads the way with flashlight in hand.  She pockets some bills.  She is followed by Annie and Ed who carry the glass case containing the missing pages and the handbag.  A grunting and sweating Jake brings up the rear, the large steamer trunk on his back. He is cursing under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ!  I thought she was talkin' 'bout them two goddamn little pieces!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind rushes fog about the place with a fury. A large moon hangs in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL HAND
dialogues.text: No longer attached to Ash's arm, it still writhes about beneath Ash's foot which pins it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he grabs the steel wastebasket, dumps out the trash lowers it quickly over the CAMERA, trapping the hand within.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: With a note of finality, Ash slams down a pile of books atop the overturned wastecan, to anchor it.  The top book's title reads "Farewell to Arms".

dialogues.speaker: FIREPLACE
dialogues.text: Ash raises a red hot fireplace shovel that had been resting upon the coals.  He grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out of frame, Ash thrusts the glowing shovel against the stump to cauterize the wound.  Red steam hisses up into frame as Ash screams.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He tosses aside the shovel and douses his smoldering stump into a vase of fresh flowers.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Unspooling a roll of duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He tapes the tablecloth into a makeshift bandage about his wrist.  Behind him, the wastebasket silently slides across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: "CLANG"! He turns to see.

dialogues.speaker: THE WASTEBASKET
dialogues.text: Upon its side.  The Evil Hand is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He turns to a "pitter patter" sound.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: It scampers across the floorboards headed for a hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED HAND, (4 SEC.)
dialogues.text: Same action as above but covered now through animation.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: Low angle tracking shot approaching the hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HAND, ASH IN BG
dialogues.text: He raises the shotgun and FIRES.  BLAM!  The floor next to the hand explodes.

dialogues.speaker: HOLE IN THE WALL
dialogues.text: The hand leaps into the hole as a section of wall next to it EXPLODES.  Blam!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash quickly reloads both chambers of the gun. He tracks the SOUND of the PITTER PATTER as the hand scampers through the sapace behind the wall like a rat.

dialogues.speaker: WALL
dialogues.text: The blasted hole at the bottom of the wall.  The hand appears, still unhurt, waving and taunting at Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED HAND
dialogues.text: As it taunts ASH it inadvertently sidesteps into a rusting mousetrap.  SNAP!  It springs shut upon the hand.  It screams furiously and shakes violently in an effort to get free the from trap.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Throws back his head in a gruff bark of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED HAND
dialogues.text: The hand throws the trap from itself and raises its middle finger to ASH, flipping him the bird.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: He raises the gun, revealing his face as the CAMERA PANS UP with his movement.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE GUN BARREL
dialogues.text: Pointed directly at the hand.  But the hand dodges away from the hole, disappearing again behind the wall.  The gun continues to track the evil hand's progress through its pitter patter sound.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S EAR
dialogues.text: The pitter patter ebbs and then peaks in volume.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE GUN BARREL
dialogues.text: Both triggers are squeezed.  BLAM!  BLAM! A 2nd and 3rd hole are blown in the wall.  All is silent.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he lowers the smoking gun.  Wondering if he has hit the hand or not.

dialogues.speaker: HOLE IN WALL
dialogues.text: All is silent for a moment, and then a slight trickle of blood comes dripping from the hole and down the side of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: For the first time feeling victorious.  As Ash continues to stare at the hole, his expression changes to one of perplexity.

dialogues.speaker: HOLE IN WALL
dialogues.text: The trickle of blood has increased to a steady flow, then, even this volume of blood multiplies.  It is forced out of the wall with a greater and greater pressure until blood pours from the wall like a fire hose.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Horrified, he spins his glance to the sound of more gushing liquid.  He is hit in the face with a geyser of deep red blood.

dialogues.speaker: 2ND AND 3RD HOLES IN WALL
dialogues.text: The 2nd and 3rd holes in wall also begin to spew blood in a geyser.  The CAMERA PANS over to the 4th of the holes.  This, too, is an eruption of blood.  The blood changes in color to a black fluid, then yellow, then turquoise.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Screaming as he looks down at his wrist.  CAMERA PANS DOWN to it.  The severed wrist begins dribbling blood. Then in a burst, it too, erupts in a hellish fire hose. It spouts blood under such great pressure that ASH is driven against the walls of the cabin because of it.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: We follow him as he slams from one wall into another.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: In the midst of his scream, drowning in the blood, it all suddenly stops.  The cabin is again deadly quiet. ASH, soaked in blood and shivering, waits.  For what, he's not sure.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he slowly backs away from the walls and sits upon the three legged chair.  It shatters beneath him, dumping him on his butt.

dialogues.speaker: CREAK
dialogues.text: ASH turns sharply to the low sound.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: The mounted moose head upon the wall.  It is in a different position.  It turns sharply towards ASH and emits a hideous cackle.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He pulls back in fear, then turns to the sound of more laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: The desk lamp on its steel swivel rises and falls in synchronization with its wheezing laughter.  Ah ha ha ha ha.  Ahhhh ha ha ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Terrified, he turns to more laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: A line of 12 old books upon the shelf flap open and closed violently as they emit a chorus of sharp laughs. Ash turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other books upon the floor laugh.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: He turns sharply toward us and breaks into an uproariously frightening bout of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The wooden door behind Ash comes to life.  It stretches out as though it were elastic with each of its own low and terrible laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING FOR TRAP DOOR, CABINETS, CLOCK
dialogues.text: Ash and everything in it are having the time of their lives.  Ash leads the bunch laughing harder and harder.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK
dialogues.text: The room's laughter suddenly stops.  Ash instantly terrified, grabs up the shotgun and fires into the door.  Blam!  Blam! PAN to the front door. Two holes are blown into the door.  We hear a short shrill scream and then all is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash opens the front door.  It slowly swings inward with a creak revealing the empty night.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND JAKE
dialogues.text: Ash approaches the front porch as Jake enters sharply into his frame.  Jake tackles Ash.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTGUN
dialogues.text: As it slides across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH, JAKE AND ED
dialogues.text: Ed enters and holds Ash down as Jake slugs him twice. Ash's fist comes up into frame catching Jake on the jaw.  Jake pulls back his fist and rockets a piledriver blow to Ash's face, knocking him senseless.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Annie and Bobby Joe enter.  Annie is taking off Bobby Joe's coat.  Bobby Joe is wounded from the shotgun blast. She holds her shoulder where the shell has grazed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be alright, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sit still fer a minute.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, ED, ANNIE, AND BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: As Jake gives Ash a swift kick in the ribs.  Ash moans. Jake turns to Ed, who is badly shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this son of a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We thought her - Annie steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Where are my parents? Annie sets down the glass case containing the pages of the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she looks down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAINSAW
dialogues.text: As it lies in a pool of blood.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie runs to Ash's semi-conscious body, grabs his shirt and violently shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did you do to them? Ed pulls Annie off of Ash. She drops Ash's moaning head to the floor and backs away from him, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Nursing his sore knuckles, he points with his elbow to the trap door that leads to the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll throw him in there.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND ASH
dialogues.text: Jake picks up Ash's body and drags him quickly to the trap door. Half conscious, Ash feebly struggles with Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy buck's gone blood simple.

dialogues.speaker: HAND HELD
dialogues.text: As he approaches the trap door almost upside down. Ed pries it open.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: In a dazed state as he is carried to the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... I made... a mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right, you flat mouthed son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND JAKE
dialogues.text: Jake kicks Ash down into the open trap door.

dialogues.speaker: ASH DUMMY
dialogues.text: Looking up at the open trap door as Ash's body falls through frame.

dialogues.speaker: CELLAR STEP
dialogues.text: As it slams into the wooden step. His feet tumble over him as he begins to fall down the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he tumbles head over heels down the wooden steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he slams to the dirt floor of the cellar.  Hard. He moans.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP TO THEM FROM CELLAR
dialogues.text: Jake, Ed and Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you rot down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash begins to realize where he is.  Growing terror on his battered face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N... No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake swings the trap door shut with a clanging of chains.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The shaft of light from above disappears and he is encased in the darkness of the cellar. From above he hears the threading of chains through eyeloops.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, ANNIE, BOBBY JOE, ED
dialogues.text: Jake has just laid Bobby Joe down upon the couch.  He dresses her wound with a towel.  Annie tosses down her co on the chair at the writing desk.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She spots the tape recorder and Kandarian Dagger.  She moves to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are my father's things. She turns on the tape recorder.  High pitched feedback and the professor's screams come from the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on Tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night Henrietta tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE PROFESSOR KNOWBY
dialogues.text: SHHH!  Listen!                    (Voice on tape) My father's voice.       I know now, that my wife has become host to a kandarian demon.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, BOBBY JOE AND ED
dialogues.text: As they turn their heads to the sound of:

dialogues.speaker: TAPE RECORDER
dialogues.text: Still playing, the tapes wind as we hear the wowing and fluttering voice of Raymond Knowby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot bring myself to dismember my wife, yet I know that I must, to halt the evil that lives within her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he lays in the center of the cellar's earth floor. He strains his ears to listen to the tape playing in the room above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is October 1, 4:33 p.m.  Henrietta is dead.  I could not bring myself to dismember her corpse.  But I buried her.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSER
dialogues.text: As he listens intently to the tape playing in the room above.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: CAMERA SLOWLY MOVING IN on the winding tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I . . . buried her . . . in the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Growing horror on his face as he realizes where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help me, I buried her in the earthen floor of the fruit cellar!

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: Ash's legs in the foreground.  Suddenly from the earthen floor of the fruit cellar a half-rotten human head juts up!  Just the eyes are above the surface of the dirt.  They dart about wildly and halt upon Ash.  Worms crawl from the rotted forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He screams.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Henrietta's arm rips through the earth and grabs Ash's leg as he tries to back away.  The corpse that was Henrietta pulls itself from the grave and emits a wail. She turns her twisted body to face Ash.  Moths fly about her in a flurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's in my fruit cellar! Someone with a fresh soul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's down there with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Can't be.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He runs up the steps to the trap door and begins pounding furiously upon it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out!  Let me out!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta lets out a terrible laugh and approaches the wooden staircase.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: All eyes are on the banging trap door.  ASH'S wild screams are coming from beneath.  They look at one another, not sure of what to do.  Jake holds the ring of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick.  I know it.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: At the top of the steps, pounding on the trap door, screaming to be let out.  HENRIETTA ENTERS the FRAME at the bottom of the steps.  A flutter of moths about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta begins to climb the steps.  Two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to me.  Come to sweet Henrietta.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: As he tries one key after another.

dialogues.speaker: KEYS
dialogues.text: As they are forced into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Sweating at the top of the steps, watching as Henrietta approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: Extending her rotted and worm infested arm toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesssssss.  You and I.  We shall spend eternity together.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Marie's shadow envelops him. He is petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first I'll swallow your soul !

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: With a sharp recoil, then spring, Henrietta makes a lunge at Ash.  Her face contorting, her teeth lengthening, her mouth opening impossibly wide as though she were going to swallow his head, and all as she lunges forward.  She changes to "Pee Wee" head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plate for previous scene.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He screams as a set of bloody hands grab his face. But they are not Henrietta's.  He is pulled upward to the main room of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Jake who pulls Ash to safety.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Jake finishes pulling Ash up from the trapdoor and onto the floor of the main room.  The horrible face of Pee-Wee head Henrietta pops from the cellar!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ED
dialogues.text: SCREAMING at the sight of the beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake!  That's my mother!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: One of Henrietta's rotted hands reach up from the cellar grabbing Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: As he moves to help Jake, Henrietta swats at his jaw, knocking him backward into a picture frame. He shatters i with his head and slumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he moves toward the trapdoor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash's foot kicks the trapdoor shut and crushes Henrietta's Pee-wee head between the door and the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: DUMMY OF HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: Ash leaps down upon the trapdoor, slamming it to pin Pee-Wee head sideways.  The pressure sends her left eyeball popping from her head, like a cork from a champagne bottle.

dialogues.speaker: EYEBALL FLYBALL
dialogues.text: Henrietta's eyeball and trailing optic nerve - mounted on glass - panning with the eyeball as it sails through space.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE, (REVERSE ACTION)
dialogues.text: As the eyeball is shot into her screaming mouth. She begins to gag on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake kicks Marie's Pee-Wee head in the face, sending her back down into the cellar. The trap door shuts. Ash leaps atop it. The sound of Henrietta falling down the cellar steps is heard along with the beast's wild ravings.  Ash quickly threads the chains through the eyeloops.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He snaps the lock shut. Ash is shaking. Jake slowly moves down into his frame. He is completely terrified. 343A  CLOSE SHOT - TAPE RECORDER IN F.G. ASH, JAKE, ANNIE AND BOBBY IN B.G. The tape recorder continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fear that whatever I have resurrected from this book, is sure to come calling for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHAKI-CAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA takes the POV of the Evil Force as it glides through the woods. Over a stump, around the Oak trees, through a patch of fog, as the cabin comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, ASH, JAKE, BOBBY JOE AND ED
dialogues.text: Ash turns to the group, Annie is placing her wet bandana atop Ed's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there.  That... witch in the cellar is only part of it. It lives out in those woods.  In the Dark. Something that's come back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: Interrupting Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, let's beat it the hell out o'here, right now.  I gotta get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Bobby, you ain't in no condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody goes out that door.  Not till daylight.

dialogues.speaker: 347A THE GROUP
dialogues.text: They freeze in their tracks as they hear a gentle voice which sings a melancholy tune.  Annie turns her head to the sound and the CAMERA PANS TO reveal HENRIETTA whos head juts in the space between the floorboards and the trap door.  She is no longer possessed.  She looks as she did earlier in the film.  She is singing a gentle song to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that song Annie?  I used to sing it to you when you were a baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Uncertain of what to do, but wanting to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out, dear.  It's so cold and dark in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlock these chains.  Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie starts to follow the instructions, but Ash halts her gently.  He shakes his head.  Annie snaps out of it.  She shakes her head and looks to the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  I don't know what you are but you're not my mother. Annie begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOOR
dialogues.text: Henrietta is crying also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that to me Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were born September 2nd, 1962.  I remember it well because it was snowing.  So strange that it would be snowing in September.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNIE
dialogues.text: Confused and tearful, she screams to the others in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing in the cellar is not my mother! Ed stands sharply into her frame.  His eyes bone white, his skin, the pale color of the dead.  His mouth has grown over large.  His lips are black.  He is possessed. He shrieks.  Annie screams and jumps back out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING
dialogues.text: He flies up into the air and writhes about as if he were a human marionette.  He lets out a demonic moan and then begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE AND JAKE
dialogues.text: As they clutch in fear at one another.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ASH
dialogues.text: As they look on in horror.  Ash steps in front of Annie as she gapes at this monstrosity that was Ed.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING
dialogues.text: As he floats about the room.  His laughter suddenly stops and a second demonic voice comes from his body. It is female, and wailing in lament.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Watching in horror.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING
dialogues.text: The body of Ed turns sharply toward the group, not really seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In the voice of POSSESSED #1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the things that were. (In the voice of POSSESSED #2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And shall be again! HA HA HA HA HA! (In the voice of POSSESSED #1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spirits of the book. (In the voice of POSSESSED #2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want what is yours!  LIFE! As he floats about, his head dips and swoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In the voice of POSSESSED #1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead by dawn! (In the voice of POSSESSED #2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead by dawn!

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA POSSESSED
dialogues.text: Sticking her gnarled head from the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead by dawn!  Dead by dawn!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING
dialogues.text: Ed floating, turns his head sharply to Bobby Joe.  The Possessed body of Ed rushes through the air towards her.  He opens his mouth wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he quickly rushes upon a screaming Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: ED AND BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: He bites into Bobby Joe's head. With a single motion he rips out the bulk of the hair from her head with a terrible RIIIIIIIIP SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: ED DUMMY
dialogues.text: Stands up into frame with a clump of Bobby Joe's hair in his mouth and swallows it.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe collapses to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA POSSESSED
dialogues.text: As she calls from the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free me!  Unlock these chains!

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED
dialogues.text: He turns to the trap door and moves toward it.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Both horrified.  Ash retreats.  Annie is shocked as she watches Ash back into the middle bedroom and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?!  HELP US!!  You filthy COWARD!

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOOR
dialogues.text: Possessed Ed moves toward the trap door. Jake comes up quickly behind Ed to grab his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DUMMY OF POSSESSED ED
dialogues.text: As Jake's hand reaches for the shoulder of possessed Ed. The head of possessed Ed spins around on its neck so that it faces Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In the voice of a woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see you!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Screaming as Ed's hand enters frame, and snags Jake's face. He tosses Jake upward.

dialogues.speaker: ED POSSESSED
dialogues.text: As he tosses Jake upward.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ACTION
dialogues.text: Jake flies upward towards the ceiling of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prop light bulb "Shining" in its fixture.  Jake's head comes flying up into frame, shattering it, and slamming into the wood ceiling and then falling back down again.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED AND JAKE STUNT MAN
dialogues.text: As Jake slams back down to the floor of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he reappears in the doorway of the room.  Now he clutches an axe in his single hand.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED
dialogues.text: As he grabs the chains that secure the trap door ready to rip them loose.  He turns his head to see:

dialogues.speaker: 372A OVER POSSESSED ED'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Ash approaches with the axe.

dialogues.speaker: DUMMY OF ED
dialogues.text: Ash exits the frame and we are left with Annie and the stark shadow of possessed Ed which is cast upon the wall behind her.  We watch as the shadow of Ash with the axe, slices through the top portion of possessed Ed's head.  Annie screams as she is splattered with green bile.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED DUMMY
dialogues.text: Missing Ed's right hand portion of his head. His brain, shriveled like the inside of a pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash stands before us, his axe dripping green bile. Ed's arms flail wildly on either side of the camera, groping at the air.  He slowly falls over and slams to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED, (FRAMED WITH AND W/O HEAD)
dialogues.text: Ed's body falls to the floor.  It lays quiet for a moment and then begins to writhe and scream in its demonic death throes.  Finally, he is silent.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ash turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start up that saw and hand it here! We're gonna cut him up. Annie looks to the chainsaw and then to the unmoving body of Ed.  She is repulsed at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Possessed Ed stands up quickly into frame!  The evil force having re-animated his lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: FLYING PLATFORM
dialogues.text: As a hand grabs Ash's throat.  Possessed Ed exits frame, revealing it to be Ash's evil hand on his own throat.  It lifts him into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S FEET
dialogues.text: As they are lifted off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pries the evil hand from his throat and falls.

dialogues.speaker: 377D ASH/EVIL HAND
dialogues.text: As he slams to the floor the evil hand scurries away in the B.G.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED DUMMY AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie is screaming in horror.  Possessed Ed backhands her across the face.

dialogues.speaker: WRITING DESK
dialogues.text: Annie slams into a desk shattering it to splinters of wood.  She falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he grabs the axe.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ED
dialogues.text: As he stands sharply into frame.  His mouth wide open and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND POSSESSED ED
dialogues.text: Terrified, as he moves toward possessed Ed with the axe.

dialogues.speaker: RUBBER AXE
dialogues.text: Ash brings the axe down upon Ed's shoulder, knocking him to the floor.  ASH swings the axe again and again. Different colors of bile and blood fly up into frame as Ash chops.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Screaming at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: His axe blade rises and falls as black demon blood flies up into frame.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ED DUMMY PARTS
dialogues.text: Ed's missing portion of his head sits upon the floor. His eye in extreme C.U. in the foreground. It looks wildly about into the CAMERA. In the background, we watch Ash bring down the axe until all is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake slowly stands into the empty frame. He is in shock from what he has just seen.  Annie slowly rises into frame - shaking her head in a silent "No." Ash slowly rises into frame, terrified. They are looking down at the out-of-frame remains of possessed Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon has grown larger.  Fog billows past the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: 390A MAIN ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jake sprays a can of air freshener about the room. He holds his nose.  Ash tosses a bloodied sheet, containing the remains of possessed Ed to the floor.
