It lands with a sickening thud.  Wiping his face with a rag, Ash moves off in disgust.  We hold on the bundled sheet as the trap door next to it silently opens. Henrietta's rotted hand emerges, unnoticed by the others in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I can't take no more of this. Henrietta's rotted hand pulls the bundle of body parts silently down into the cellar and quietly closes the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake moves to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That trail we came in here on... well, it just ain't there no more. Like the woods jus' swallowed it. The room goes quiet.  The sound of the wind outside the cabin has died.  Jake and Bobby Joe cock their heads to this new silence.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ASH
dialogues.text: She looks about the room, getting scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so quiet. Ash stands slowly into frame.  He knows that it can't be good.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: As they raise their heads to a distant pounding sound. It grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe something... Something trying to force its way into our world.

dialogues.speaker: 393A EYEMO CAMERA/MITCHELL CAMERA
dialogues.text: The cabin WALL.  Bang!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe runs to Jake's arms.  He clutches her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ASH
dialogues.text: Annie runs to Ash.  He holds her.  The pounding sounds halt.  Again they are left in silence.  Annie awkwardly disengages herself from Ash.  They hear a sound coming from the middle bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in there.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR TO MIDDLE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: It is opened a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all go in together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no, you're the curious one.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: He moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you. Ash nods to Annie in a show of thanks.  He grabs the axe, and pushes open the door to the middle bedroom. Annie follows with the flickering oil lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the main room creaks open.  Ash and Annie cautiously enter.  They look about the place.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: As the CAMERA PANS the shadowed corners of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: An eerie whistling wind is heard.  It has an other worldly sound, very far off.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY TO MIDDLE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe and Jake enter the room, drawn by the sound.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: She looks about, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: Jake takes Bobby Joe's hand.  Bobby Joe smiles, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: PANNING THE DARK ROOM
dialogues.text: As the eerie whistling sound grows louder.  It is followed by the angry sound of something moving violently about the room.  A shattering of glass.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: WOOOOOSH!  The group is hit with a tremendous blast of air.  They shiver from the cold.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The wind in the room suddenly stops.  He blows out his breath and watches it vaporize.  The screaming face of Raymond Knowby emerges from the wall.  A life like spirit made of swirling smoke and mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: They turn to the ghost in fear.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: Awestruck.  Bobby Joe crosses herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Mother O'Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a dark spirit here that wants to destroy you.  Your salvation lies in the pages from the Book of the Dead. The ghost of Raymond points to Annie's glass case. CAMERA PANS to it.  Inside are the pages from the Book.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recite the passages.  Dispel the evil. Save my soul... And your own lives. The ghost of Raymond screams and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Whoosh!  Again they are hit with a blast of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, you squeezing my hand too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't got your hand, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who...? Bobby Joe raises her hand into frame, to reveal Ash's Evil Hand clutched in hers.  Bobby Joe goes nuts, screaming and flailing about trying to throw the hand from her.  She slams into the lantern, knocking it out. We lose them in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody get the light! The sound of chairs being pushed over.  The sound of a door opening and closing.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he lights the lantern illuminating the room. CAMERA PANS over to reveal only Jake and Annie.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Looking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Bobby Joe's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming, Bobby Joe makes a mad dash away from the cabin.  It diminishes in size behind her, she has had enough of it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: As she races through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs deep into the woods, still looking behind her as she slams into a twisted oak tree that stops her flat. An angry face appears on the surface of the tree.  Its gnarled bark folds open to reveal very human like oversiz eyes.  A large fold in its bark opens to form a gaping mouth dripping tree sap saliva.

dialogues.speaker: JONES' CREEK
dialogues.text: Screaming as she backs away from this living tree as a flurry of snake like vines pick themselves up off of the ground and come to life about her.

dialogues.speaker: JONES' CREEK
dialogues.text: Two living vines wind their way toward her legs and coil around her ankles tightly.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JOE
dialogues.text: She lets out a short shrill scream, as her shirt is torn away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living vines wind around Bobby Joe's torso and breasts in a furious wrapping motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A living vine wraps around her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny vines wrap around Bobby Joe's hand and fingers.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCRANKED
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe, wrapped in vines, is reeled backwards and ripped through a wall of branches.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCRANKED
dialogues.text: At a great speed, Bobby Joe is pulled away from the cabin and towards the forest by the vines.

dialogues.speaker: STUNT
dialogues.text: As the vines rocket her on a speeding FAST MOTION joyride along the forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING EFX
dialogues.text: As she drags along the forest flctor, the smaller vines force their way into Bobby Joe's nose and mouth and then under the first layer of her facial skin.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGWAY
dialogues.text: She is pulled along the ground and down into a foxhole (dummy).  Camera continues tracking along her original trajectory until we come to the second foxhole where she emerges, now covered in mud, and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: DUMMY
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe rips through spikes extending from a log and is dragged through two mud puddles.  The vines wisk her away.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING EFFECT
dialogues.text: She hits a swamp with a giant splash, but even this does not stop her.

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERTAIL WATER SPRAY EFX
dialogues.text: She glides across the surface of the swamp with a great roostertail spray of water, as if she were on water skis.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING EFX
dialogues.text: She hits the other side of the swamp and is rocketed out of the water and across the forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: STATIC CAMERA
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe comes roaring towards us, screaming.  She rips past.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCRANKED
dialogues.text: From BEHIND CAMERA Bobby Joe appears and goes racing into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGING EFFECT
dialogues.text: Darting in and around trees, a major stump is coming right for her.  Bobby Joe's legs spread wide.  The tree stump races closer.  Bobby Joe SCREAMS . . . her last.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION
dialogues.text: Girl meets stump.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD GEYSER EFX
dialogues.text: We hear the RIP!  And watch as a geyser of blood floods up into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD
dialogues.text: It falls away from the CAMERA and shatters on the table beneath us.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: As their hands scramble at removing the pages from the bits of broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE IN FG
dialogues.text: Jake is looking out the boarded window of the cabin, searching for some sign of Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK WOODS
dialogues.text: All is silent as fog rushes in and around the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is she?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Jake turns to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go out there and find her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she went out in those woods, she's not coming back. Jake turns back to the window.  Ash turns to Annie. He glances down at the pages that Annie is looking over.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: One of the pages is a clear pictorial of Ash as the "Hero from the Sky."

dialogues.speaker: 445B ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ash shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felt like someone just walked over my grave.  It's that picture. Annie looks to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1300 AD.  This was the "Hero from the Sky," who was prophesized to destroy this Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do a very good job. What about the passages?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she quickly gives the pages a cursory glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is.  Two passages. For the first time, she smiles at Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got it!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Finally seeing his salvation, his face shows hope.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie reads through the pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recitation of the first passage will make this "Dark Spirit" manifest itself in the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell would we want to do that? Annie thumbs through one or two of the other pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recitation of the second passage creates a kind of rift in time and space, and the physical manifestation of this spirit can be forced back through this rift... to an earlier time and place.  At least that's the best translation I can ....

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie and Ash look up to the source of the sound.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He has just snapped a shell into the firing chamber of the shotgun.  He points it at Ash and Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm runnin' the show now.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Standing together, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're goin' outside into those woods to look for Bobby Joe, an' once we find her, we're gettin' the hell outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to look for her, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two comin' with me.  I ain't goin' out there alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, YOU IDIOT.  You'll kill us all. She's dead by now.  With these pages we can... Jake grabs the pages from Annie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those pages don't mean shit. Jake kicks the pages down into the cellar.  Ash and Annie look on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sides.  Now you ain't got no, choice. Jake pushes at Ash with the barrel of the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move! Ash hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move you son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash, Annie and Jake exit the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BACKWARD
dialogues.text: Ash, Annie and Jake walk towards the woods.  In the FG is Ash.  He looks off past the CAMERA in fear.

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: As he approaches a line of trees whose branches bend and sway with a threatening motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trail.  Which way do you intend to go?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Looking confused and frightened.  He calls out desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WOODS NIGHT
dialogues.text: As it glides through the woods.  We hear a muted shout from Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe, where are you girl? And the POV of the force suddenly swings about to reveal Jake, Ash, and Annie not to far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves deeper into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she searches the woods with her eyes in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As scared as the rest of them, but driven to find Bobby Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it approaches the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe!  Bobby Joe! Ash approaches Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get us all killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaddup! Jake slams Ash across the face with the stock of the shotgun.  Ash plummets to the ground.  Annie screams!  She goes after Jake.  Jake slugs her and she falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL FORCE
dialogues.text: It draws closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raging to the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV of Evil Force racing up to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake halts his screaming.  He listens in the silence as possessed Ash juts up into the frame!  His eyes are bone white, his flesh, the pale color of the dead. His lips, black.  He bellows to the night!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She screams and stumbles backwards, towards the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: Possessed Ash lifts Jake up above his head and throws him into a large tree.  It explodes in a blast of sawdust as the dummy slams into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie dashes inside and turns to look out the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: THRU THE OPEN DOORWAY
dialogues.text: All is quiet outside, no sign of Possessed Ash or Jake, and then Possessed Ash is there, emerging from the darkness suddenly.  He raises his finger and points to Annie.  He speaks in the low garbled voice of a demon:

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She rushes to the door, hoping to get there before Possessed Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: She slams the front door shut just in time.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She picks up the Kandarian Dagger.  CREAK - SNAP! A sound coming from somewhere in the rear of the cabin.  She turns toward the door to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: It is closed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She moves to investigate the sound.  As she approaches the rear door to the hall and slowly opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door to the hallway is pulled open, revealing ... only the empty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she moves down the hall.  It is dark.  Curtains flutter on the boarded windows.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she moves towards the rear of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW AND WOODS BEYOND
dialogues.text: We approach the window and look out into the night. Fog billows through the trees, and in the distance the monster that is Ash emerges.  He heads toward the cabin and disappears in a bank of fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is frightened.  She spins her head to a sound.

dialogues.speaker: THE REAR DOOR OF THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Creak!  The doorknob is turning.  Something is trying to get in.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She forces her back to the wall.  She tenses with the dagger, ready to slay whatever should enter.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She waits.

dialogues.speaker: THE KANDARIAN DAGGER
dialogues.text: Gripped tightly in Annie's sweating hands.

dialogues.speaker: DOORKNOB
dialogues.text: Rattling violently now. And suddenly it opens.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: As they swing the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dagger imbeds in the intruder's chest.  CAMERA PANS UP quickly to reveal a gasping Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Jake falls to the ground, half in and out of the doorway. He is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she backs away in horror, clutching at her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She backs to a partially boarded window.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Possessed Ash juts up into frame in the window behind her.  Annie screams and runs toward the open back door. Possessed Ash spots the open door through the window and begins to move around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she goes to slam the door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: As he lies moaning in the doorway, the door slams upon him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she reaches down and pulls Jake's body out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: As he moves around the side of the cabin, tearing apart a trellis that stands in his path, and three hanging flowerpots as he approaches the open door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Again she tries to slam the door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S DUMMY ANKLE
dialogues.text: Which lies in the door's path, preventing it from closing

dialogues.speaker: OVER POSSESSED ASH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As he approaches the back door. He grabs the screen door and tears it loose with a single motion.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she pulls Jake's ankle from the door and slams it. All is again silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie kneels down next to a moaning Jake, driving the dagger in a little deeper by accident.  He cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the axe.  Kill it.  Kill it. Jake moans and dies.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she turns her head to the sound of breaking glass.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she cautiously approaches the main room.

dialogues.speaker: REAR HALLWAY/MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: As she moves towards the main room.

dialogues.speaker: 509E MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Annie enters the room.  She shudders from the cold.  CAMERA PANS with her glance to broken glass upon the floor, and over to reveal the bashed out window and the curtains fluttering in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Petrified.  Looking about.  Knowing that the monster Ash may be lurking close.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she moves about the main room, picking up the axe. With her back toward us she doesn't notice Ash's hand appear suddenly in the foreground atop the writing desk. She turns suddenly towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: 509H OVER ANNIE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Ash's evil hand sits upon the table.  It scampers off. Annie turns and comes face to face with Possessed Ash! He bellows at her and grabs her as she shrieks bloody murder!

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: He picks her up and swings her across the room, into the wall.  She slumps to the floor unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: As he lumbers toward her.

dialogues.speaker: STAR FILTER
dialogues.text: As he moves closer to her unmoving body.  A glitter of light on the floor, next to her, catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: For the first time, calm, as he looks intently down at the floor.  He kneels closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NECKLACE of Linda.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: The sight of the necklace strikes the human cord within him.  He is confused, his evil self, battling for control of his spirit and body.  He reaches to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: As he slowly picks up the delicate silver necklace. He raises it to his face;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never take it off. And then it hits him.  The emotion of love lost. It floods the monster that is ASH.  He clutches the necklace tightly to his bestial chest.  And as the Love/waltz theme sweeps up in volume on the sound track, the monster begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ash raises his head and lets out a low, lamenting, and pitiful wail.  A man trapped in the shell of a beast, crying for the one he has lost.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED ASH
dialogues.text: As he raises his head.  Tears stream down from his eyes, washing away the caked on blood.

dialogues.speaker: BLADDER EFX
dialogues.text: His face begins to change.  His skin loses its white pallor.  His blackened, infected cuts disappear.  The swollen and cracked surface of his face begins to heal.

dialogues.speaker: W/FLUID EYE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Ash's eyes change from white to brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last tears roll down Ash's face, he is once again human.  Ash looks up suddenly with a start.

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODING FLOOR
dialogues.text: As he rolls out of the way a moment before the head of the axe buries itself in the wooden floor.  Splinters fly.

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODING WALL EFX
dialogues.text: Rolls to his feet and stands.  He ducks as Annie enters frame, charging him with axe, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  WAIT! Annie swings the axe and again Ash ducks.  The head of the axe slams into the plastered wall smashing right through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash grabs her tightly with his remaining hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  I'm all right now.  That thing is gone. Ash pushes her away.  Annie falls to the floor.  She stands.

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODING WALL EFX
dialogues.text: Catching his wind for a moment.  Then rolls to the side as the axe again comes at him!  SLAM!  The head of the axe slices into the wall only a few inches from his head.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: As he grabs Annie by the face and forces her backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOD DAMN IT!  I said I was all right!! Annie is nearly choking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Ash releases her gently.  She again looks to Ash, cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be the first to know. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but for how long? If we're going to beat this thing, we need those pages.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he turns to the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's head down into that cellar...

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOOR
dialogues.text: It lies silently against the floor.  A rasping breath can be heard from below.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He turns from the trap door to Annie. ASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And carve ourselves a witch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash's hand flips open the latch on the shed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked open, revealing the silhouette of Ash and Annie as they stand in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WORKSHED SHELF
dialogues.text: Rats scurry for safety as the shaft of light from the door hits them.

dialogues.speaker: HANGING BULB
dialogues.text: ASH'S hand pulls on the cord, turning on the light.

dialogues.speaker: WORKSHED TABLE
dialogues.text: Ash's arm sweeping the chains and pieces of wood onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSE CLAMP
dialogues.text: Is tossed down upon the workshed table.

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND HOSECLAMP
dialogues.text: Is tossed down next to the first.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Hold down a clamp as ASH'S hand, creates screw sized holes in it with a battery powered drill.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Attach the hoseclamps to a piece of red steel.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Attach the red piece of steel to ASH'S stump, via the clamps.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Attach a "V" type hook Around Ash's neck, just above his bicep.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: Slams down the chainsaw upon the table.  It is missing its side panel.  ASH'S arm enters frame and we see that it is this missing side panel that has been clamped to his stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panel slides into the side of the chainsaw with a sharp "CLICK".

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he bends the chainsaw to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "T" shaped end of the starter cord falls neatly into the "V" shaped hook that is strapped around Ash's neck.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He looks up to Annie, the moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hair tousled over her sweating face, returns his glance, expectant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash extends his chainsaw arm, pulling on the starter cord.  The CHAINSAW ROARS to life.  With his free arm Ash raises the shotgun.  He lowers the blade of the chainsaw down upon the barrel.  Sparks fly as the saw cuts through it.  The long barrel falls to the floor. Ash is left with a sawed off shotgun in one hand and a chainsaw strapped to his other arm. With a fancy style western flip to the gun Ash saddles the shotgun in a makeshift holster, strapped to his back. The CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS into Ash's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the tiny figures of Ash and Annie as they move from the workshed to the cabin.  In the foreground is a large oak tree.  A gnarled human- like face can be made out on the surface of the tree. It is lit from beneath and slolwly brought up on a dimmer.  A horrible twisted tree face.  It suddenly opens its mouth and breathes in a gust of air with a terrible wheezing sound, as though in great pain at being brought to life.  It turns sharply towards the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: DINKY PUPPET
dialogues.text: Second tree face, brought up on a dimmer, opens its mouth and loudly draws in air, also in agony.

dialogues.speaker: MOE PUPPET
dialogues.text: A third tree's twisted face, two human eyes opened wide on its surface.  It breathes, then barks a guttural sound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground is the base of a large oak tree.  The cabin in the distance.  A rumbling is heard.  Then suddenly the tree pulls one of its massive roots from the earth.  The tree sets its root down a few feet closer to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: TREE PUPPETS
dialogues.text: An entire line of trees.  All pull their roots free from the soil and take an awkward and lumbering step towards the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLADE OF THE CHAINSAW
dialogues.text: Begins cutting through the wood of the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Tensing with her axe, ready for the beast to spring.

dialogues.speaker: CHAINSAW BLADE
dialogues.text: As it completes the second cut in the wood of the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he finishes the slicing job and kicks open the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ASH
dialogues.text: The broken bits of the trap door fall past the camera, as they cautiously peer down into the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down into the cellar.  No sign of Henrietta. The bottom of the steps disappear into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those pages are down there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He kicks aside the broken trapdoor and slowly descends into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash arrives at the bottom of the steps. He looks about the dark corners of the cellar trying to find some sign of Henrietta or the pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panning the cobwebs and dark stone walls of the cellar. Half hidden in the shadows we see two of the missing pages.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he moves through the cellar and grabs the pages.  He spots another page somewhat deeper into the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fourth and fifth page lay upon the earthen floor, at the base of the cellar's rear door.

dialogues.speaker: 575C ASH
dialogues.text: Ash moves to pages and gathers them. Annie's voice calls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's playing hard to get... He pumps the throttle on the buzzing saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... rid of. Behind Ash, unseen by him, a shadow darts by.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He hears a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is coming from the door to the cellar's rear room.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He reaches for the door and opens it.  Revealing darkness beyond.  Ash enters.  Again he hears the slight sound, a gentle ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ticking sound is coming from behind a hanging drape.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He approaches the drape, reaches out his hand and pulls it back sharply.  Revealing an old water heater, ticking and steaming.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He breathes a sigh of relief as the half eaten skeleton torso of Ed falls atop him!  Ash screams and steps sudden away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's skeletal carcass falls to the earthen floor still wrapped in the bloody sheet.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Looking on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got hungry. Ash turns from the skeleton and quickly gathers up the remaining pages from the Book of the Dead.  Getting scared now, he backs into the cellar's front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves towards the steps.  He tosses up the bundle of pages.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Peering down into the cellar, she grabs the pages.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She rushes over to the writing desk and begins translating.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Getting scared now, decides to exit the cellar.  He climbs the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S FEET
dialogues.text: As they climb. From behind the wooden steps, the horrible head of Henrietta appears.  Her two rotting hand grab at Ash's ankles.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He looks down with a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to me.  Come to sweet Henrietta! Her face pulls back behind the cellar steps.  Her hands pull ASH's feet in after her.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As Ash falls, he slams his jaw down upon the bottom step.

dialogues.speaker: CHAINSAW ARM
dialogues.text: As the spinning blade jams into the step, stalling the engine.

dialogues.speaker: ASH DUMMY
dialogues.text: (UNDERCRANKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an instant, his entire body is pulled beneath the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she sits at the writing desk, reciting the first of the passages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nos-feratos-allo-memnon-kanda! She puts aside the pages and glances up suddenly at the faint sounds of the struggle from the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash's badly mauled body rips through the staircase with a great force.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he slams into the earth floor of the cellar.  He moans, and looks towards the steps.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODEN STAIRCASE, (REVERSE ACTION)
dialogues.text: As a cackling Henrietta appears where the bottom section of staircase used to stand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she races from the writing desk to look down into the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ANNIE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As she kneels down at the trapdoor, about to call down to Ash when the witchlike figure of Henrietta floats quickly up into the main room from the cellar.  A flurry of moths about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free!  Free at last!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As Annie attempts to move from the trap door.  Henrietta is clutching at Annie's hair and laughing with a demonic malice, as she spins about the room in mid air.

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOOR
dialogues.text: Ash's bloodied arm slings itself over the edge of the trapdoor.  He pulls himself up into the main room.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Henrietta turns sharply to Ash with a growl.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He stands and jerks out his chainsaw arm sharply.  The cord is pulled and the engine roars to life!

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: As she leaps through the air toward Ash.

dialogues.speaker: RACING AT HIM
dialogues.text: Ash swings his buzzing chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA'S GNARLED HAND
dialogues.text: As it grabs the body of the chainsaw, halting it in mid swing.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: As she keeps the buzzing chainsaw at bay with one hand, while her other grabs at Ash's throat, strangling him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he is slammed through the window.

dialogues.speaker: 600B ASH AND HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: Ash kicks her in the stomach.  Henrietta is furious.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION/REAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: She grits her teeth, concentrates, and her neck begins to grow.  She begins to change to Pee Wee Head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS UP on "B" wall.

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION/REAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: As the pee wee Head transformation continues, Henrietta's neck grows, like a jack in the box.  It extends a solid five feet upward, so that her head is now looking down upon Ash baring its teeth.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA CRANING UP ON HIM
dialogues.text: Ash gapes in fear at this monstrosity that looms above him.

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED HENRIETTA PUPPET
dialogues.text: Her neck undulating like a snake, she bites and snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll swallow your soul, swallow your soul!

dialogues.speaker: 603B ASH
dialogues.text: He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: AND ASH
dialogues.text: Henrietta swoops at Ash as he keeps her at bay with the buzzing chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD
dialogues.text: She opens her mouth impossibly wide, exposing those nasty rows of jagged shark like teeth.  She dive bombs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plate for previous scene.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA'S HEAD AND ASH
dialogues.text: As her head springs down into frame and halts suddenly inches from his face.  In the silence we hear the reason: Annie's voice singing the same melody that her mother had sung to her earlier from the cellar.  For a moment Henrietta's face loses its evil malice.  She is confused at this sound. Henrietta halts.  She spins her head toward Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: As she finishes the melancholy song.

dialogues.speaker: MAGIC BLADE AND GUIDE TRACK RIG
dialogues.text: Still confused, suddenly she shrieks and the chainsaw comes buzzing through her from behind.  The spinning blade juts out from Henrietta's midsection.

dialogues.speaker: BODY PARTS ON WIRES
dialogues.text: Body parts (2 arms) fly past the camera on wire. Ash slices and dices.  Henrietta screeches like a wild banshee. 608   CLOSE SHOT - HENRIETTA'S HEAD AND ANNIE IN B.G. As Pee Wee Head spins toward Ash, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow your soul!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Swings his chainsaw arm in a sharp arc.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA
dialogues.text: Henrietta's head is sliced from her neck with a chainsaw.  Steam pours from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA'S HEAD
dialogues.text: As it flies up into frame, sliced from its neck.

dialogues.speaker: 610A ASH
dialogues.text: As he completes the arc of the chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: W/ SMALL SECTION OF NECK
dialogues.text: As it hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTA'S BODY
dialogues.text: It's neck spouts steam, wagging about like a snake. Behind her Annie watches as the body topples to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow your soul!  Swallow your soul! Ash's foot steps down upon her head, pinning it to the floor.  Her neck still writhing.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He unsaddles his sawed off shotgun from the holster on his back.  He points the barrel at her head point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow this. He pulls the trigger.  BLAM!  Flame barks from the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head explodes into a million pieces.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND ASH
dialogues.text: Annie is crying.  Ash holsters the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May she rest in pieces.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: As they look at each other for a quiet moment of relief.  Ash shuts off the chainsaw.  Annie moves slowly to Ash's arms.  He holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull apart and look into each others eyes.  Annie holds the pages.  Maybe they can get away after all.  A LOUD BOOMING echoes throughout the cabin!  As though the outside walls of the place were being bombarded by cannon balls.  The kitchen wall behind them buckles.

dialogues.speaker: SQUIB ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: As the B - board of the wall behind Ash falls away revealing battered logs.  The mirror shatters.

dialogues.speaker: 3 CAMERAS
dialogues.text: The wall cracks beneath the terrific force of whatever is outside hammering upon it.

dialogues.speaker: "B" WALL
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS in on them as they look about in fear. Dust is falling about them.  The cabin walls are starting to break apart.  There is a tremendous "Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea" type jolt to the cabin.  Ash and Annie stagger for footing.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash grabs ahold of the window frame to brace himself.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ACTION
dialogues.text: Vines wrap about the planks which cover the window.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Behind him, the planks in the window are ripped away by finger-like vines.  A terrifying tree face on the surface of a giant oak is revealed, as it peeks in through the window at them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She screams. She turns toward "D Wall" at a loud wrenching sound.

dialogues.speaker: "D" WALL WINDOW
dialogues.text: As vines reach in the cabin, tearing away the planks revealing an even more horrible tree face.

dialogues.speaker: TREE PUPPET
dialogues.text: A tree beats its branches furiously upon the EXT. wall of the cabin.  It rips apart the cabin's stone chimney.

dialogues.speaker: TREE PUPPET
dialogues.text: A second gnarled tree slams its trunk against the rear door of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: TREE PUPPET
dialogues.text: The entire cabin is surrounded by a group of lumbering oaks.  All working to get in at Ash and Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie runs to the writing desk.  She flips through the missing pages from the Book of the Dead.  Dust from the ceiling drifts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting above the noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I only completed the first of the passages.  And that was to make the evil a thing of the flesh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it roars out of the woods, and towards the distant cabin faster than we've ever seen it.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he runs over to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't finish it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still the second passage. The one to open the rift and send the evil back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start reciting it.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it rockets towards the cabin doing 80 mph.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Shouting to be heard as she continues reading from the passage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tar-tra Kanda-Estra!  Hudsucker Proxy -- Kanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forest at night.  Bubbling smoke appears, then flame.  Through the smoke, the beginnings of a winding spiral of a cloudlike material.

dialogues.speaker: 634AP2 PLATE FOR PREVIOUS SCENE
dialogues.text: The rift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aton-Neran-Ofas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it races right up to the front door of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Reading from the passage.  Behind her, the front door rips open and in comes a giant rotten apple head of the evil entity made flesh.  A SHRIEKING, BULBOUS BEHEMOTH!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash as he witnesses the most horrible sights a man can behold.  Ash's black hair streaks white before our eyes.  Behind him, two flowers in their pots wither and die in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plate for previous scene, with dying flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanda!  Samonda Roba Areda Gyes Indy En-zeen, Nos-Feratos -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie as she gasps.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED HAND
dialogues.text: Annie as she falls to the floor, dead. Jutting from her back is the Kandarian dagger and hanging onto the end of the dagger is Ash's demon hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: Behind Ash a living tree branch rips through the cabin window!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash turns suddenly to get away.  Too late.  The living branch wraps about ASH'S waist and lifts him, screaming, OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: ASH IN GRIP OF TREE BRANCH
dialogues.text: Ash is being lifted toward the gaping mouth of rotten apple head.  Ash is frantically jerking out his arm in an attempt to start the chainsaw strapped to his wrist. PUTT, PUTT, PUTT. It won't start.  As the face of rotten apple head looms close, it opens its terrible mouth, ready to consume him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH IN GRIP OF GIANT TREE BRANCH
dialogues.text: From inside the creature's mouth looking out.  Ash is screaming as he is brought towards its gnashing teeth.  PUTT, PUTT, PUTT.  His chainsaw still won't start.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Half dead as she crawls to the pages on the floor and gasps out the final sentences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nos-feratos - Amen-non.  Ak-adeem! Razin - Arozonia!

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ACTION
dialogues.text: The rift grows more powerful.

dialogues.speaker: 643BP PLATE FOR PREVIOUS SCENE
dialogues.text: The rift.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Sweating and terrified. He draws closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks in toward the mouth of rotten apple head.  It's massive jaw jutts from the head, biting and snapping.  Sap-like saliva drips from the orifice. Ash's feet kick at the mouth of rotten apple head, trying to keep it away.  Its jaws snap at his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: RAH'S MOUTH.
dialogues.text: SNAP! The massive teeth snap together biting Ash's foot in half.

dialogues.speaker: 645B C.U. ASH
dialogues.text: He screams, then looks down to his foot.

dialogues.speaker: 645C C.U. ASH'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Missing the leather toe section, he reveals that he still has his toes intact.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he sharply jerks his arm outward!  The CHAINSAW ROARS to life!  He raises it high above his head and plunges it forward.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ROTTEN APPLE HEAD
dialogues.text: Ash thrusts the spinning chainsaw blade into the single eye of the beast.

dialogues.speaker: CHAINSAW
dialogues.text: As it punctures the giant eyeball and then pulls free. Green sauce spouts from the creature's wound.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he is doused in the green bile.  SPLAT!

dialogues.speaker: ROTTEN APPLE HEAD
dialogues.text: Eyeless, it screams in anger.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: With her last gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....Kanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rift pulls in fog and trees that surround the house.

dialogues.speaker: 651P2 PLATE FOR PREVIOUS SCENE
dialogues.text: The Rift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As rotten apple head is sucked out the doorway of the cabin.  The door slams shut behind it.  Its scream echoes off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Slices through the bracch.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Ash and cut branch fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin becomes much more quiet.  The sounds of the trees are gone.  Ash looks to Annie.  She is dead.  Ash moves to her, strokes her hair and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it.  By God you did it. He lowers his head and begins to heave in sharp convulsive breaths of despair.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Behind Ash the front door RIPS open with a TREMENDOUS BLAST.  The door is sucked down into the rift.  All of the objects in the room are sucked through the open doorway and down into the rift, including the pages of the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: WIND FAN
dialogues.text: Ash grabs ahold of the kitchen window ledge so as not to be swept outside by the force of the vacuum of the rift.  Objects and papers fly past him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: Upon the kitchen window ledge.  The ledge tears free.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: As he screams, flying backward, towards the open door.

dialogues.speaker: WIND FAN
dialogues.text: The open doorway to the cabin.  Ash flies towards it and is snagged from going through by the section of ledge that he holds.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: His body is horizontal, his feet dangling in air, in the direction of the rift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash as he hangs on for dear life. Objects continue to fly past on wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, how do you stop it?

dialogues.speaker: FLYING RIG
dialogues.text: The nails in the section of ledge that Ash holds TEAR loose and the ledge SNAPS in two.  He spins wildly away from us and towards the rift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash is rocketed through the air, spinning somersaults.

dialogues.speaker: ASH ON FLYING RIG
dialogues.text: Ash is sucked down into the swirling rift.  Like a particle that is swallowed by a deep funnel of draining water.  The rift closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plate for previous scene.

dialogues.speaker: ASH ON FLYING RIG
dialogues.text: We are now within the vortex.  A swirling mass of colors and clouds.  And nightmarish sound effects. Objects come AT US from the distance and roar past, an uprooted tree, the grandfather clock with its hands winding backwards at an incredible rate, Ash spinning AT US, hand over foot, screaming.  The chainsaw still mounted to his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: The vortex is distorting Ash's features as he is rocketed back through the dark void of time.

dialogues.speaker: 673P2 PLATE FOR PREVIOUS SCENE, (STOCK FOOTAGE)
dialogues.text: A wild and rapid pictorial collage of human history winding back from the present through the centuries lasting seven seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole opens in the air with a sharp CRACKLING SOUND. Ash is spat from this hole and falls downward through frame.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: Plunged to the dust.  Debris from the demolished cabin rains down around him; his shotgun, the 1973 Delta 88 Oldsmobile and the old grandfather clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it seals shut, leaving only the blue sky and the sound of tweeting birds.  Ash's view of the serene sky changes abruptly as five steel helmets jut into his line of sight.  Five armor-clad medieval WARRIORS stand directly over him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND WARRIORS
dialogues.text: As he looks to the warriors above him. The first warrior raises a bloodstained longsword and poises it above Ash's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slay the beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Tis a deadite! All raise their swords ready for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS
dialogues.text: Halt as they hear a piercing, high-pitched SCREECH. They turn their heads skyward.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Follows the Warriors' gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STOP MOTION/REAR SCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "WINGED DEADITE," a female harpy like creature with the tail of a sea horse and man-sized bat wings, enabling it to fly.  The screaming beast swoops down towards the warriors and horses. High above, the distant shapes of other Winged Deadites circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STOP MOTION ANIMATION/REAR SCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: WINGED DEADITE
dialogues.text: She lets out a screaming banshee laugh, while swooping down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we swoop down toward the warriors and Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND WARRIORS
dialogues.text: As he springs to his feet.  With a lightning thrust he reaches behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S HAND
dialogues.text: As he grabs at the gun from its holster.  He swings it around front and pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: GUN BARREL
dialogues.text: It discharges flame.

dialogues.speaker: OVERCRANKED
dialogues.text: It explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MINIATURE/STOP MOTION/REAR SCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: WINGED DEADITE
dialogues.text: The beast continues to flap its wings and fly about a moment before falling to a heap in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: WARRIOR
dialogues.text: As he looks to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: WARRIORS
dialogues.text: They follow his gaze.  The CAMERA PANS TO Ash.  He stands alone on a small pile of rubble clutching his smoldering shotgun.  He looks about dazedly.  He tries to get his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: WARRIORS
dialogues.text: They falter.  Unsure of how to react to this strange man, who a moment before was pronounced a Deadite. From the crowd, the Warrior #1 calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail he, who has come from the sky, to deliver us from the terrors of the deadites!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail! The cry is taken up by all. A line of medieval warriors bow.  Then twenty.  Then fifty.  All remove their helmets and kneel silently in the dust. Somewhere in the distance a DRUM SOUNDS.  Ash stands frozen.  Terrified, unsure of where or when he is. Knowing only for the present, he is alive. As the wind kicks up blowing dust, Ash strikes a familiar pose.  It is the same image of the "Hero from the Sky" that we saw earlier in the film.  The strange "jagged edged longsword" is Ash's chainsaw. The CAMERA PULLS BACK from him as a great medieval castle rears up INTO FRAME.  It is seen to be the castle of Kandar.  The same castle we saw in the beginning of the film.  Now, however, the castle is not a ruin, but brand new.  As the CAMERA continues to pull back from Ash, the title "EVIL DEAD" appears on the screen acompanied by the distant ROAR of some dying animal:  The SCREEN cuts to BLACK WITH A THUNDEROUS BOOM. THE END
